attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This trend chart is your first stop for understanding the rhythm of changes in your environment.
It helps establish a baseline of normal activity to quickly identify deviations.
Use it to spot anomalies at a high level. A sudden, unexpected spike in changes could indicate a major software deployment, a configuration update, or potentially unauthorized activity that warrants immediate investigation.

**How:** Hover over the chart to see the exact number of changes at any given time.
Use the time selector to zoom in on periods of interest.
If you see a spike, note the time and use the 'Detailed System Change Events' table to investigate the specific events that occurred during that period.

query.query: (event.category:package AND event.type:(installation OR deletion OR change)) OR (event.category:service AND event.type:(start OR stop OR change)) OR (event.category:configuration AND event.type:change)

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-002087] System Change Events Over Time

attributes.description:
**Why this visualization works:** This visualization displays the maximum anomaly score over time for the job monitoring system change events. It helps analysts quickly spot unusual spikes or trends in system changes that might bypass rule-based alerts, such as unexpected installations, deletions, or configuration modifications. 

**How an analyst can use it:** Look for any sudden increases in the anomaly score. A high score suggests a significant deviation from the normal pattern of system changes. Use the time selector to pinpoint these periods and investigate the specific `host.name`, `user.name`, `event.category`, and `event.action` associated with the anomaly to determine if the change was authorized and intentional.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-002087] ML - System Change Events Anomaly Trend (converted)

attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-002087, focusing on monitoring system change events. This visualization displays the health status of system change event monitoring based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'user.name: <user_name>' to focus on a specific system or user. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline, which could signify unauthorized system changes, misconfigurations, or unusual activity that warrants immediate investigation.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-002087] System Change Events Monitoring ML

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This is your primary tool for investigating the specifics of a change to determine its security impact.
When you need to understand the 'who, what, and when' of a change, this table provides the necessary context.
Use it after identifying a suspicious time frame from the trend chart or when you need to audit all changes on a critical system.

**How:** Use the column headers to sort the data.
For example, sort by `host.name` to group all changes for a specific server.
Use the search bar within the visualization to filter for specific users, processes, or file paths.
This detailed view is where you will correlate system events with change management tickets to verify that all modifications were authorized.

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-002087] Detailed System Change Events
